channel.title: Time to move on - Time to BEND!
channel.description:
Firstly I would like to say that 93dcthugs93 has come up with something you may or may not have heard of, Bender.
It is a new bot that is going to be hitting the scene in the near future.
You can check out www.NextG3n.com for all of the information you need, and if you have any questions regarding Bender, you can ask those there as well!
[center][b]www.NextG3n.com[/b][/center]

item.title: Time to move on - Time to BEND!
item.dc:creator: @hdkilla HDKilla
item.description:
@hdkilla wrote:

[quote=“Algas, post:24, topic:3490”]As HDKilla asked
Spam cleared and topic is open again.

DOOMSDAY YOU STAY OUT OF HERE OR I WILL USE MY ADMIN POWERS TO PUNISH YOU! DONT DARE ME![/quote]

Thank you Algas :D[br][size=1]Posted at: June 13, 2006, 05:02:34 pm[/size][hr]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=5281.0

Im in need of a programmer(s) to create a new “hybrid”, “bot”, or anything of the sorts for Runescape 2.

Now I know that you all must be thinking why would I be looking for a programmer when I have dcthugs working on Bender, well, simple, hes very busy with real life matters right now, so hes taking a bit of a leave of absence, which will encompass a month or two.

So I figured why not get something else on a lower scale rolling, such as a “hybrid”, basically this is an open post for anyone to take on the challenge of creating something that will provide the RS2 cheating scene something new and innovative.

If you are willing to work on this project, and are very serious about programming, then please contact me through a PM, I will then give you my MSN so we can continue to talk through there.

Now the price range for this project will be around $500.00 USD (depending), this price all depends on what you create, if its something simple, it could be less, so you are working for your own price basically.

Im looking for ANYONE that is interested, or if you know anyone that has the knowledge to create anything, PM me their MSN, forum names, anything!!

Have fun with this, please!

-HDKilla Smiley

Read full topic

item.title: Time to move on - Time to BEND!
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

doomsday, ALL java deob bots were done by forced commands.
aryan, sbot, ruinbot, american bot etc.
the reason it was so detectable was when it was released to the public, jagex caught on, had a look at it and found out how to detect it. also, i dont know if this is true or not, but some people are saying the devs screwed over the bot because it got abused by leeches, by making the bot send packets which still worked, but it was obvious to jagex they were aryan packets (but this might just have been caused by making it public as i stated before)

Read full topic
item.source: Time to move on - Time to BEND!

item.title: Time to move on - Time to BEND!
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

doomsday:

i already answered it, the packet that is returned when you mine a piece fo coal!!!

Are you sure there is one?
If I remember correctly (keeping in mind that I haven’t looked at RS2 protocol in a long time), the way it works is:
client sends, basically, “actionX click(objectX,objectY)”
The server decides that an object at (X,Y) responds to actionX. Let’s say it’s a rock. The server receives the action and changes the rock’s state to “mined” in the next object-state update. Then it adds another piece of coal to your next inventory update. It might send you a text message that says “You have mined coal” but it could just as easily be a message that says “Welcome to RuneScape!”

There isn’t a “OK you mined coal successfully!” packet, just the related effects. You could detect by checking for any of them.

Read full topic

item.title: Time to move on - Time to BEND!
item.dc:creator: @kmb Kmb
item.description:
@kmb wrote:

[quote=“93dcthugs93, post:14, topic:3490”][quote author=kmb link=topic=4174.msg43711#msg43711 date=1149528123]
Cool. Still thats not “just a small piece of the findnpc method”. Thats about the whole method.

BTW: is it a coincidence that the names of both methods are the same? Why do you have the exactly same method in “your” bot called KillerScript323. I’m pretty sure RuneScape client #323 wasn’t released just 3 months ago ;). FYI, it was released soon after Joujoujou released the findNPCXY and findNPCXYFree.
[/quote]
Hmm looking back at the source now I did use joujoujou’s method for finding an npc, but {b]I also have roughly 50 of my own methods I made from scratch in killerscript[/b] and now looking at the old readme from killerscript it gave him credit. On a second note that wasn’t the correct end of the method. It actually ends quite differently than that. It’s settup to send a packet containing the ints instead of just returning them.[/quote]
Actually, they were from RuMod2 by ghostmagem, but whatever suits you best ;D.

Read full topic

item.title: Time to move on - Time to BEND!
item.dc:creator: @93dcthugs93 93dcthugs93
item.description:
@93dcthugs93 wrote:

Xerxes:

Dude, why you rip. Roflmao. And you take paid for making a ripped bot? Rofl rofl rofl.

shut your fucking mouth moron. Even if that one method was a rip there is soo many classes for Bender so far.
A very small peice of the packet class-

import java.net.;
import java.io.;

public class Packet
{
public static void Handle(byte[] bytes)
{
String msg = “Handle”;
try
{
msg = “Handle/bytes.length”;
if(bytes.length < 1)
return;

		PacketReader data = new PacketReader(bytes);

		int id = data.TakeByte();
		int size = data.TakeShort();

		switch(id)
		{		
                              


			        case 0x01: //walk
                                    Bot.Debug("Received packet 0x01. Sending new packet");
				int x = data.TakeShort();
				int y = data.TakeShort();
				int[] walk_coords = BotFuncs.walk(x, y);
				short x_screen_coord1 = (short) walk_coords[0];
				short y_screen_coord1 = (short) walk_coords[1];

				Packet d = new Packet(0x01);
				d.WriteShort(x_screen_coord1);
				d.WriteShort(y_screen_coord1);
				Bot.SendPacket(d);

this is a very small peice of the packet reader

import java.net.;
import java.io.;

public class PacketReader
{
private byte[] m_Data;
public PacketReader(byte[] data)
{
m_Data = data;
}

public boolean TakeBool()
{
	int ret = ReadByte();
	Kick(1);
	return (ret == 0) ? false : true;
}

public int ReadByte()
{
	return (int) m_Data[0];
}

public int TakeByte()
{
	int ret = ReadByte();
	Kick(1);
	return ret;
}

A little from the class bot

import java.net.;
import java.io.;

public class Bot extends Thread
{
public static Socket link;
public static InputStream input;
public static OutputStream output;

public void run()
{
	while(true)
	{
		try
		{
			Connect();
			Thread.sleep(1000);
		}
		catch(Exception e)
		{
			Debug("run(): " + e.toString());
		}
	}
}

public static void Connect()
{
	String msg = "Connect(): ";
	try
	{

		Debug("Attempting connection...");
		link = new Socket("127.0.0.1", 5844);
		input = link.getInputStream();
		output = link.getOutputStream();
		
		Debug("Connected!");

There are soo many classes and such that 1 method is a mear dot of the whole application. If you think i’m a thief you can kiss my ass. I have been here contributing for about 4-5 years of my life so far. If you think Benders a rip off like I just said kiss my ass. Anyone want to call me a ripper then you can kiss my ass aswell. If anyone continues to piss me off I will ban you from every cheating community that I have access to the DB. I don’t care who you are either.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @93dcthugs93 93dcthugs93
item.description:
@93dcthugs93 wrote:

[quote=“moparisthebest, post:10, topic:3490”][quote author=93dcthugs93 link=topic=4174.msg43102#msg43102 date=1149349498]

I guess the rs engine update ruined the aryan updater you use to use for bender. Bender has been in the works for over 3 months.

Haha. Guess what erik I had a different updating method before I switched to aryans updater. The reason I switched to aryans updater is to make it easier on adding other commands. To prove I had an updater before I used aryans updater here is a snippit of one of my many methods.
public int[] findNPCXYFree1(String name) {
try {
for (int i = 0; i < aClass24_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_Sub1Array1232.length; i++) {

 				Class24_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_Sub1 npc = aClass24_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_Sub1Array1232[i];
 				
 					if(npc != null) {
 					method93(((Class24_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4) (npc)), ((Class24_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4) (npc)).anInt1489/3, (byte)-122);
 						Class2 npcDesc = npc.aClass2_1711;  						

 						if (npcDesc.aString68.trim().equalsIgnoreCase(name) && inArea(anInt1277,anInt1278,7,7,515,335) && !(((Class24_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4) npc).anInt1529 > anInt1006)) {
 							System.out.println(((Class24_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4) (npc)).anInt1533+" "+((Class24_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4) (npc)).anInt1534+" "+((Class24_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4) (npc)).anInt1489);

Thats just a small peice of the findnpc method. As for pre-selling of authentications I don’t believe HDKilla is selling auths untill the bot is fully funtional. On another side note there will be a free trial. Ruler_Erik don’t continue trying to second mind me as I will make you look dumb every time.
[/quote]

you dont run the client renamed like that do you? because that == ban[/quote]
Nope I sure don’t I just had to mess with the latest deob.

Congratulations. This is the code Joujoujou posted on Kaitnieks' forums over a year ago. This is the exactly same code (with updated variables) that was used for Bot2 A YEAR AGO.

Haha.

I just wrote this code about lets say 3 months ago or so. There aren’t too many ways of writing this method so I guess it’s about what works works. On another note I used to release a shitload of methods to the old kaitnieks aswell and had no real use for others snippits really becuase I had my own bot to maintain during the duration of time your speaking of. If you strongly insist thats his code then tell him to talk to me and I will tell him how I wrote the code, where I found things and how I found them. Every way that I found methods was debugging. I had system out prints when certain methods were called upon.

 							System.out.println(((Class24_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4) (npc)).anInt1533+" "+((Class24_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4) (npc)).anInt1534+" "+((Class24_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4) (npc)).anInt1489);

On another side note there will be a free trial. Ruler_Erik don’t continue trying to second mind me as I will make you look dumb every time.[/quote]
Shall I complete the snippet for you Sir?

[code]return new int[]{anInt1277,anInt1278};
}
}
}

 		} catch (Exception e) {
 		System.out.println("Error in findNPCXYFree()");
 		e.printStackTrace();
 		}
 		return new int[]{-1,-1};
 }[/code]

Congratulations. This is the code Joujoujou posted on Kaitnieks’ forums over a year ago. This is the exactly same code (with updated variables) that was used for Bot2 A YEAR AGO.

Haha.
